documents.title: key changes
text: this document sets out some of the key changes made to the tax collection and management ( wales ) bill during stage 2 proceedings .

documents.title: no change to welsh revenue authority name
text: nick ramsay admits to being 'trigger-happy ' in tabling over 500 amendments regarding the name of the new body , welsh revenue authority .
mr ramsay 's attempt to rename it revenue wales fails .
the minister says that to change the name would be `` confusing and unproductive '' .

documents.title: tax collection and management ( wales ) bill
text: members have a 10 minute break before moving on to a stage 3 debate on the tax collection and management ( wales ) bill .
the purpose of this bill is to put in place the legal framework necessary for the future collection and management of devolved taxes in wales .
in particular , the bill provides for the establishment of the welsh revenue authority ( wra ) , whose main function will be the collection and management of devolved taxes .

documents.title: no objections to the proposal
text: there were no objections , so the proposal on the draft agricultural advisory panel for wales ( establishment ) order 2016 is passed .

documents.title: agricultural advisory panel for wales
text: members move on to discuss and vote on the draft agricultural advisory panel for wales ( establishment ) order 2016 .

the agricultural sector ( wales ) act 2014 places a duty on the welsh ministers to establish the agricultural advisory panel for wales with the aim of providing further support to the professional functioning of the agricultural industry '' .

documents.title: teachers ' pay and conditions should be devolvednick servini tweets
text: @ fmwales tells ams he 's always believed that teachers ' pay and conditions should be devolved , which @ twitterid is going to look at .

documents.title: 'a flawed process '
text: the first minister says `` we do now have an opportunity - if the will is truly there - to repair the damage done by a flawed process and produce a genuinely meaningful piece of legislation '' .
mr jones says he 's had no discussions with stephen crabb since the welsh secretary announced a major re-think of his plans for greater devolution yesterday .
mr crabb has said he would shorten the list of powers kept back by westminster , cut red tape over new laws , and better reflect wales in the legal system .
his initial proposals had been widely criticised for being over-complex , with suggestions the list of powers kept back being too long .

documents.title: statement by the first minister : the draft wales bill
text: members move on to a statement by the first minister on the draft wales bill .
for six questions and answers on the next stage of devolution , please read here .

documents.title: business statement and announcement
text: after jane hutt 's business statement and announcement outlining the future business of the assembly , members raise a variety of to including world book day , the appointment process for a new chair for the arts council for wales and astronaut tim peake 's .
st david 's day message from space .

documents.title: tackling cancer waiting times
text: what action is being taken to tackle cancer waiting times in the south wales central area , asks andrew rt davies .
the first minister says cancer waiting times in wales have consistently been better than in england .

documents.title: 'challenging to recruit gps '
text: there are parts of wales where it 's challenging to recruit gps , concedes the first minister to liberal democrat leader kirsty williams .

documents.title: the end of 'great place names '
text: conservative leader andrew rt davies asks about local government re-organisation and the end of `` great place names '' of existing counties .
the first minister says the intention is to press ahead and suggests that mr davies is already implying he wo n't win the election .

documents.title: what have you won from westminster for wales ?
text: the election is a chance to seek a mandate on the future of devolution , says plaid cymru leader leanne wood .
mr jones says he and she are on the same page when it comes to the wales bill .
what have you won from westminster for wales , asks ms wood .
the first minister refers to the 2011 referendum .

documents.title: 'significant investment '
text: the first minister argues the life sciences investment fund has brought significant investment .
it is understood the venture has created more than 150 highly-skilled jobs in wales .

documents.title: handling of £ 50m science fund criticised
text: conservative william graham and liberal democrat aled roberts refer to criticisim of the welsh government for the way it set up and ran a £ 50m biotech investment fund .
the wales life sciences fund was set up in 2012 to get more medical and pharmaceutical firms to move to wales .
the wales audit office ( wao ) said ministers should have handled potential conflicts of interest `` more robustly '' .

documents.title: 'slow progress ' on accounts
text: asked about the welsh government 's presentation of its accounts , the auditor general huw vaughan thomas says `` we are continuing to make slow progress in trying to get accounts to a more accessible format .
`` my aim is to try to push the welsh government into having a budget and accounts that can be very easily compared by department as well as en bloc '' .

documents.title: accounts of a selection of taxpayer-funded organisations
text: from 2014 , the public accounts committee decided to consider the accounts of a selection of taxpayer-funded organisations in wales .
in 2015 , the committee considered the accounts of the following bodies :
national library for wales
national museum wales
sport wales
assembly commission
welsh government .
the committee is now considering responses to its report .

documents.title: current value on cardiff airport of £ 55 million
text: the public accounts committee notes six papers about cardiff airport , one of which states that the latest audited hold co accounts prepared by grant thornton llp place a current value on cardiff airport of £ 55 million '' .
it was bought by the welsh government for £ 52m in 2013 .

documents.title: happy st david 's day !
text: it 's exactly 10 years since the £ 67m senedd building in cardiff bay was officially opened by the queen .

she was accompanied by the duke of edinburgh , the prince of wales and the duchess of cornwall in the presence of assembly members , parliamentarians and representatives from the uk , europe and the commonwealth .
in his opening speech on the floor of the siambr ( the debating chamber ) , first minister rhodri morgan compared it to the uss enterprise from the popular us tv series star trek .
mr morgan stated : `` this new chamber with all its computers has been likened to the control room of the starship enterprise . ''
he added : `` now that 's progress for you - boldly going into the future . ''
